contest-event.event-date: Oct. 19, 1946 D National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Oliver Cromwell Royal Albert Hall, Kensington, Kensington and Chelsea, Greater London, England, UK Henry Geehl was appointed referee. Prizes: 1st: 200 Guineas 2nd: 150 Guineas 3rd: 75 Guineas 4th: 50 Guineas Awards presented at the evening Festival Concert. The contest started at 12.00 noon. Cory Workmens were listed in the programme but did not compete at the contest. The programme cost 6d and all proceeds went to Great Ormond Street Hospital for Sick Children. May 12, 2010, 10:33 a.m. May 2, 2013, 2:20 p.m. 1 Brighouse and Rastrick Band Eric Ball 2 Fairey Band Harry Mortimer 3 The GUS Band Stanley Boddington 4 Hanwell Band George Turner 5 Parkhead Forge (Glasgow) George Hawkins 6 Camborne Town Band A.
